filmography.title: Great Expectations
filmography.role_description: The cheerful and loyal friend to Pip who teaches him how to be a gentleman in London; Guinness's first major film role.
filmography.plot: A humble orphan suddenly becomes a gentleman with the help of an unknown benefactor.

filmography.title: Oliver Twist
filmography.role_description: The sinister, grotesque leader of a gang of child pickpockets who takes Oliver into his criminal underworld.
filmography.plot: An orphan boy runs away from a workhouse and meets a pickpocket on the streets of London.

filmography.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
filmography.role_description: A tour-de-force performance playing eight different members of the aristocratic D'Ascoyne family, including a suffragette and an admiral.
filmography.plot: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Chalfont plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Last Holiday
filmography.role_description: A polite agricultural salesman who, told he has only weeks to live, decides to spend his final days at a posh resort.
filmography.plot: A man diagnosed with a terminal illness decides to spend his last days at a high-end hotel, where his luck and life change dramatically.

filmography.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
filmography.role_description: A meek bank clerk who concocts a plan to steal gold bullion and smuggle it out of the country as Eiffel Tower souvenirs.
filmography.plot: A meek bank clerk who oversees the shipment of bullion joins with an eccentric neighbor to steal gold bars and smuggle them out of the country.

filmography.title: The Man in the White Suit
filmography.role_description: An eccentric chemist who invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out, causing panic in the textile industry.
filmography.plot: An altruistic chemist invents a fabric that resists wear and stain as well as chopping, but the textile industry tries to suppress it.

filmography.title: The Promoter
filmography.role_description: A charming and ambitious young man from the lower classes who finds clever, often manipulative ways to rise in society.
filmography.plot: A washerwoman's son rises in society through his charm and a series of clever schemes.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Detective
filmography.role_description: G.K. Chesterton's intuitive, crime-solving priest who tries to save the soul of a master thief while tracking him down.
filmography.plot: A priest with a knack for solving crimes pursues a thief across Europe to recover a stolen religious cross.

filmography.title: The Prisoner
filmography.role_description: A Roman Catholic Cardinal in a totalitarian state who engages in a psychological battle of wills with his interrogator.
filmography.plot: A Cardinal is imprisoned and interrogated by the state in an attempt to force a false confession of treason.

filmography.title: The Ladykillers
filmography.role_description: A ghoulish, stringy-haired criminal mastermind who rents a room from an elderly widow to plan a heist.
filmography.plot: Five diverse criminals rent a room in an old lady's house to plan a robbery, but she begins to suspect them.

filmography.title: The Swan
filmography.role_description: A reserved, dutiful crown prince who visits a noble family to determine if their daughter is a suitable bride.
filmography.plot: A princess is urged by her mother to marry her cousin, a crown prince, but she is attracted to the family's tutor.

filmography.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
filmography.role_description: A rigid British colonel in a Japanese POW camp whose obsession with discipline and duty leads him to build a bridge for the enemy.
filmography.plot: British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors, not knowing that the allied forces are planning to destroy it.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Horse's Mouth
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, disheveled, and brilliant painter who harasses his friends and patrons in his obsessive pursuit of art.
filmography.plot: The adventures of a roguish artist who searches for the perfect surface to paint on, often destroying property in the process.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Adapted Screenplay; Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Our Man in Havana
filmography.role_description: A vacuum cleaner salesman in Cuba who is recruited by British intelligence and begins inventing fake agents and reports.
filmography.plot: An expatriate Englishman living in Havana creates a ring of fictional spies to satisfy his British intelligence superiors.

filmography.title: Tunes of Glory
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, whiskey-drinking Scottish acting colonel who clashes tragically with his rigid new commanding officer.
filmography.plot: A popular acting C.O. in a Scottish regiment locks horns with his strict, by-the-book replacement.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: The shrewd and dignified Arab leader who navigates tribal politics and colonial powers to secure his people's future.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I.

filmography.title: H.M.S. Defiant
filmography.role_description: A humane British naval captain who tries to maintain order and justice against a sadistic executive officer and a mutinous crew.
filmography.plot: During the Napoleonic Wars, a British ship captain contends with a cruel second-in-command and a crew on the verge of mutiny.

filmography.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
filmography.role_description: The philosophical and weary Roman Emperor who seeks a successor who will bring peace, realizing his own son is unfit.
filmography.plot: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis between his corrupt son Commodus and his loyal general Livius.

filmography.title: Doctor Zhivago
filmography.role_description: The protagonist's half-brother, a dedicated Bolshevik and KGB officer who narrates the story and searches for his niece.
filmography.plot: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to an aristocrat, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and the October Revolution.

filmography.title: The Comedians
filmography.role_description: A fraudulent British 'war hero' in Haiti who gets caught up in a failed rebel plot against the dictator Papa Doc.
filmography.plot: The cynical owner of a hotel in Haiti becomes involved with a group of rebels and the wife of a foreign ambassador.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Cromwell
filmography.role_description: The stubborn, divinely-appointed monarch whose refusal to compromise with Parliament leads to the English Civil War.
filmography.plot: Oliver Cromwell leads the parliamentary forces against the King in the English Civil War.

filmography.title: Scrooge
filmography.role_description: A playful yet tormented ghost of Scrooge's partner who floats through the air warning him of his impending doom.
filmography.plot: A musical retelling of Charles Dickens's classic novel about a miser who is visited by three ghosts on Christmas Eve.

filmography.title: Murder by Death
filmography.role_description: The blind butler who serves a group of famous detectives invited to a dinner party to solve a murder.
filmography.plot: Five famous literary detective characters and their sidekicks are invited to a bizarre mansion to solve an even more bizarre mystery.

filmography.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
filmography.role_description: A wise and secluded Jedi Master who mentors Luke Skywalker and introduces him to the ways of the Force.
filmography.plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station.

filmography.title: A Passage to India
filmography.role_description: An enigmatic Brahmin scholar and philosopher whose cryptic wisdom mystifies the British characters.
filmography.plot: Cultural mistrust and false accusations doom a friendship in British colonial India between an Indian doctor, an Englishwoman engaged to a city magistrate, and an English educator.

filmography.title: Little Dorrit
filmography.role_description: The 'Father of the Marshalsea', an elderly man who has lived in a debtors' prison for so long he has become its preeminent figure.
filmography.plot: Arthur Clennam returns from foreign business and becomes intrigued by a young seamstress who works in his mother's house.
